definition: to set fire to/to burn down/burning hot/baked cake
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
lit. the fire burns one's eyebrows (idiom); fig. desperate situation/extreme emergency
restless with anxiety/unbearably hot and anxious
nuée ardente/hot cloud of volcanic ash
stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt/fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling
lit. even a prairie fire cannot destroy the grass - it grows again when the breeze blows (proverb)/fig. cannot be easily eliminated/abbr. to 野火春風|野火春风[ye3 huo3 chun1 feng1]
pinyin: ye3 huo3 shao1 bu4 jin4 , chun1 feng1 chui1 you4 sheng1
containing_words.word: 野火烧不尽，春风吹又生

sentences.english: And the Philistines came up, and burnt her and her father with fire.
sentences.chinese: 于是非利士人上去，用火烧了妇人和她的父亲。

sentences.english: However, where you can eat authentic donkey to fire it?
sentences.chinese: 但是你在哪里能吃到正宗的驴肉火烧呢？

sentences.english: Her head and back felt on fire.
sentences.chinese: 她的头和背感到火烧火燎的。

sentences.english: The Hada Cake looks like a round casket.
sentences.chinese: 哈达火烧的形状像上下合在一起的小圆盒子。

sentences.english: And he called the name of the place Taberah: because the fire of the LORD burnt among them.
sentences.chinese: 那地方便叫作他备拉，因为耶和华的火烧在他们中间。

sentences.english: He threw the snakeskin into the fire and watched it burn.
sentences.chinese: 他把蛇皮扔进炉子里，眼看着被火烧成了灰烬。

sentences.english: And when Sparta burns, you shall bathe in gold.
sentences.chinese: 当斯巴达被火烧的时候，你们讲沐浴在黄金里。

sentences.english: The knaves who set fire to the barn have been caught and sent to the prison.
sentences.chinese: 纵火烧谷仓的骗子被抓起来送到牢里去了。

sentences.english: The oil of lamp is worn out because it burns itself to illuminate other.
sentences.chinese: 灯油被火烧尽，则是基于它燃烧自己照亮别人的特性。

sentences.english: The blaze was contained mostly to the fourth floor of the five-story building, the news agency said.
sentences.chinese: 大火烧了五层楼的四层楼，新闻媒体说。

sentences.english: He claimed that he didnt set fire to the church.
sentences.chinese: 他坚持说没有纵火烧教堂。

sentences.english: Or it is like holding onto hot coals, but you're the one getting burned.
sentences.chinese: 或许这就像手持热炭，你却引火烧身。

sentences.english: But I set fire to the rain.
He set fire to his own house.
sentences.chinese: 他纵火烧了自己的房子。

sentences.english: The police blamed him of setting fire to the building.
sentences.chinese: 这个警察责备他放火烧了这个建筑。

sentences.english: Who set fire to the city of Rome?

definition: to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
to have a fever reaching (a certain temperature)
to discharge smoke/to fume with rage
to scorch/(of the sun) to beat down on
